note: Armed conflict in Syria has displaced more than a million civilians since the begining of the conflict. Many are crossing borders into Jordan, Lebanon, Turkey and Iraq, straining the capacity of host communities and governments.
More than 200,000 people have fled their homes in Mali since January 2012, when rebels seized control of the northern part of the country.
Since June 2011, heavy fighting in Sudanâ€™s South Kordofan and Blue Nile states has driven tens of thousands of people across the border into Ethiopia and newly independent South Sudan.
